items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.08
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Extension of Agreement for Program Management Services (Measure "G") Between Seville Group, Inc. and East Side Union High School District
	 
	 
Since 2003, SGI has been Program Manager for the Measure "G" Bond Program pursuant to a Program Management Agreement with the District.  Amendment #1 to the Program Management Agreement dated August 26, 2005, extended the term of that Agreement to December 2010.
	 
Administration recommends that the Board consider extending the Program Management Agreement on an interim basis for ninety (90) days, to and including March 31, 2011, pending a review of the Measure G Program and a further recommendation from Administration no later than the March 2011, Regular Board Meeting.
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Authorize and direct Administration to enter into an extension of the Program Management Agreement for Measure G with SGI for a period of up to ninety days, to and including March 31, 2011.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees authorize and direct Administration to enter into an extension of the Program Management Agreement for Measure G with SGI for a period of up to ninety days, to and including March 31, 2011.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  11.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-20 In Support of Full State Funding of County Mental Health Services for Children with Disabilities
	 
The East Side Union High School District, as a district in the Santa Clara County SELPA, supports appropriate state and federal funding for the costs to school districts to provide special education services to children with disabilities in accordance with state and federal mandates.  In recent years, special education funding has not kept pace with the escalating costs.  Since special education services are an entitlement for each child with a disability, local districts must utilize general fund revenues to meet the excess costs.
	 
The Governor's recent veto of funding to provide county mental health services consistent with AB 3632/1984 to our children with disabilities will mean even greater increased costs to school districts if not reversed.
	 
The attached resolution for the Board's consideration urges the Governor and the State Legislature to provide full funding for AB 3632/1984 mental health services for children with disabilities.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2010/2011-20 In Support of Full State Funding of County Mental Health Services for Children with Disabilities.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2010/2011-20 in Support of Full State Funding of County Mental Health Services for Children with Disabilities.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.01
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve First Interim Financial Report for 2010/2011
	 
	 
These are unprecedented times in the history of California for public education funding. This report reflects the change in beginning balance resulting from the Unaudited Actuals, the Federal Jobs funds and the State budget from October. 
	 
The 2010-2011 First Interim Financial Report projection reflects reinstatement of the statutory reserves for this and next year but show a shortage fro 2012-2013 of $4 million.
	 
Current State requirements obligate local school boards to certify the financial condition of the school district into one of three conditions which are:
POSITIVE CERTIFICATION -…based upon current projections this district will be able meet its financial obligations for the current fiscal year and subsequent two fiscal years.
QUALIFIED CERTIFICATION - …based upon current projections this district may not meet its financial obligations for the current fiscal year or two subsequent fiscal years.
NEGATIVE CERTIFICATION - …based upon current projections this district will be unable to meet its financial obligations for the remainder of the fiscal year or for the remainder of the fiscal year or for the subsequent fiscal year.
What the attached 2010-2011 First Interim Financial Report shows is that the District will be able to meet its financial obligations and reserve requirements for the current fiscal year plus meet the financial obligations but not the reserve requirement for the immediate subsequent year. The report does project that the District may not be able to meet its financial obligations for the 2012-2013 fiscal year.  
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that given the current financial projections the Board of Trustees approve a Qualified Certification of the 2010-2011 First Interim Financial Report.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that given the current financial projections the Board of Trustees approve a Qualified Certification of the 2010-2011 First Interim Financial Report
items.item_text: Approve First Interim Financial Report for 2010/2011 - Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
items.item_text_raw: 13.01 Approve First Interim Financial Report for 2010/2011 - Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.02
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve the Master Business Relationship Agreement with East Side Union High School District and Metropolitan Education District for 2010/11
	 
	 
The District is party to a joint powers agreement with five other school districts that creates the Metropolitan Education District (MetroEd).  The Metropolitan Education District Joint Powers Agreement (JPA) anticipates the negotiation of separate master business agreements between MetroED and each participating school district governing their financial and operational relationships.  Attach is the Master Business Relationship Agreement between East Side Union High School District and Metropolitan Education District for the 2010/11 school year.
	 
In 2008/09 fiscal year participating school districts agreed to equalizing funding in the JPA which had the effect of reducing the funding per ROP satellite ADA for ESUHSD.  This agreement suspends that reduction during the current economic slump.  The MetroEd District has distributed one time funds to participating school districts to assist with budget difficulties.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Same level as 2009/10
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Master Business Relationship Agreement between East Side Union High School District and Metropolitan Education District for the 2010/11 school year.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.05
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Contract for Professional Services over $50,000
	 
	 
The Contract for Professional Services over $50,000 listed below is being recommended for Board approval and to delegate authority to the Superintendent or designee to amend said contract and purchase orders on an as needed basis, including funding.
	 
1.  Intrepid Electronic Systems
Reviewed by:
Contract Period
Fiscal Impact/
Funding Source
School/Department/
Manager
Mac Cage
Jerry Kurr
Donna Bertrand
					 
July 1, 2010 – June 30, 2011 (term modified)
					 
					 
$75,000.00 (increased amount)
					 
					 
					 
District Wide/Information Technology
					 
Mac Cage
	 
East Side Union High School District (ESUHSD) Administration is requesting authorization from the Board of Trustees to approve change order #2 to Intrepid Electronic System’s Contract/Purchase Order for the provision of maintenance services to the fire alarm system at all ESUHSD sites.
	 
On June 22, 2010, the Board approved a contract with Intrepid for the maintenance of the fire alarm systems for all ESUHSD sites; at the November 18, 2010, Board meeting change order #1, was approved to increase the contract.  Administration is requesting another extension to the term and increase in funds to cover the extension.  ESUHSD has been experiencing more fire alarm issue.  ESUHSD Administration is currently working on a formal solicitation process.  This extension is needed to continue with the services on an as needed basis.
	 
Original contract amount $10,000.00, plus change order #1 $15,000.00, plus change order #2 $75,000.00, for a total Contract/Purchase Order amount of $100,000.00.
	 
RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve change order #2, to Intrepid Electronic System’s Contract/Purchase Order for the provision of maintenance services to the fire alarm system at all ESUHSD sites for the extended term through June 30, 2010, and to delegate authority to the Superintendent or designee to amend said contract and purchase orders on an as needed basis, including funding.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the contract for professional services as listed and to delegate authority to the Superintendent or designee to amend said contract and purchase orders on an as needed basis, including funding.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.06
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Receive Electrical Energy Usage and Cost Report for Phase I Solar Project
	 
	 
The attached schedule provides a comparison of the electrical energy usage and cost between the first three months of last school year and those same months for this school year for the six high school sites where photovoltaic modules were installed during Phase I of the project.  The specific energy usage is that which is drawn from and provided by Pacific Gas and Electric.  The schedule shows that the district used approximately 1.2 million kilowatts less this year at a reduced cost of $330,000.  Because there are other factors that affect usage it cannot be concluded that the Phase I installation saved the District exactly $330,000 for three months.  It could be less and it could be more.  The ambient temperature for each year, usage or demand and atmospheric clarity are a few of the factors that have an impact on this type of comparison.  
	 
The 15 year guarantee that the District was given by Chevron Energy Solutions (CES) was for the energy production of each one of the installations.  CES and the District have the capability and technology to monitor the production on a real time basis for each installation.  Staffs have been trained to utilize this application and do test and reports for verification of the production output.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive the Electrical Energy Usage and Cost Report for Phase I of the Solar Project.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive the Electrical Energy Usage and Cost Report for Phase I of the Solar Project.

PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Accept Warrant Register for the Month of November 2010
	 
	 
Attached is a list of warrants issued during the month of November 2010, in response to board Policy 3314 Payment for Goods and Services adopted by the board in May 2009.  The Policy states that, “The Board shall approve all warrants (checks) at a regularly scheduled Board meeting".  While there is no legal requirement for Board approval of issued warrants, this list and future lists will add to the “transparency” of when the Board approves purchase orders, contracts and other authorized expenses as per Board Policies.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable

It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the Warrant Register for the month of November 2010.
